intro: Tetratheca pilosa subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved tetratheca, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its narrow, often hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It is often found in open habitats such as woodlands and heathlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The subspecies latifolia is distinguished by its broader leaves compared to other subspecies within the Tetratheca pilosa complex.
